tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool creates a PyMol session, which can be used to produce a movie with PyMol.
**Input Parameter**
Following parameters should be entered to allow a flawless computation:
pdb-file three letter code of ligand chain of the binding pocket in question selection which colorscheme to use
Example: 1r4l.pdb XX5 A Yes
**Output**
The tool produces two output files. The pymol session (\*.pse) can be downloaded as pse file and loaded with pymol. In addition a pymol script-file (\*.pml) which was used for the generation of the scenes in the pse file, can be downloaded separately. Pymol script files can conveniently be executed via the commandline ind the graphical interface with the command
\@scriptfile
**DEBUGGING**
If there is no molecule present in the binding pocket, make sure you defined the correct ligand residue name, this script will already try to guess the chain identifier.
